title: Soraka -- Appearance
body:
I'd just like to get everyone's opinion on Soraka's appearance. Does it bug anyone else that her splash art is purple and sleek, making her appear as if she will be elegant and beautiful in-game; and then she's awkward blue and clunky in-game?


{{champion:16}} Beautiful Icon
[Actual In-Game Appearance](http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120920224830/leagueoflegends/images/thumb/c/cd/Soraka_Render.png/215px-Soraka_Render.webp)
[Splash Art](http://lolwp.com/wp-content/uploads/Soraka-Classic-Reworked.jpg)
[What should be her splash art](http://www.leaguesplash.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/Soraka-Classic-Ch.jpg)

If you're just here to hate please don't waste your time, I'm just curious about responses of the people this actually bugs. I personally love Soraka, and play her all the time. Yes, even with her rework, even though it has it's downsides I still like the champ and don't plan on ceasing my use of her anytime soon. I just wish that while I played her she could be a little more aesthetically pleasing.

Also I apologize in advance if this is an inappropriate forum for this post! This is the first time I've used the League forums :x
(For those who don't like links, the images are uploaded as attachments below)

I honestly don't feel there's that big of a disparity between her model and her artwork. The only major difference is her skin color, which has already been addressed by Riot once...The only thing I would give you is that her idle stance isn't very "Graceful" looking.

But, that's about it.
Her face is a bit different, but that's not really noticeable on the field. The colour is the biggest and an obvious problem.

I always just thought it was her magic glowing that made her appear to look purple. The only thing I can complain about is the way she walks now... They changed her from elegant to rough. it doesn't suit her and I want her elegant walk back!{{item:3151}}

It has to do with when she was VU'ed.

They focused a lot more on her spell particles than her model, and there was a rift in the community at the time. Some wanted her to be more monstrous whereas others wanted her more humanoid.

I'm guessing it was hard for Riot to decide which direction to go.
Sorry for lacking on the lingo, lol, but what does "VU'd" mean? haha

> Sorry for lacking on the lingo, lol, but what does "VU'd" mean? haha

Visual Updated

It was not the controversy per se. Riot always had communication problems between the 3D graphics department and the 2D art departmend.

(compare the innitial versions of the new Wukong and Ahri splashes, or the innitial release of Jinx (in game she was tan).

I'm fairly certain that riot had outsourced their splash art fairly often in the past and just did touch ups to them once they're done. This would result in some fairly different visuals if riot made any last minute changes to in game looks. Splash art done "in house" may be done more often now as they seem to be more consistent.
